categories.name: The Art of Sushi: From Nigiri to Rolls

questions.clue: This type of sushi consists of a slice of raw fish, often tuna, laid on top of a small mound of vinegared rice.
Known for its fiery kick, this green paste is often served with sushi and is made from a plant in the mustard family.
This type of sushi roll includes the seaweed on the outside, often filled with cucumber, crab, and avocado.
In Japan, this term refers to sushi made with cooked ingredients like eel or shrimp, often used for rolls.
This traditional Japanese technique involves fermenting fish with rice, a precursor to modern sushi.

categories.name: Nobel Prize Winners: Discoveries That Changed the World

questions.clue: This scientist won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921 for his explanation of the photoelectric effect, a fundamental principle in quantum mechanics.
In 1962, James Watson, Francis Crick, and Maurice Wilkins shared the Nobel Prize for discovering the double-helix structure of this molecule, the blueprint of life.
This physicist won the Nobel Prize in 1927 for his work on the wave equation, crucial for understanding electron behavior in atoms and named after him.

In 1984, Niels K. Jerne, Georges J.F. Köhler, and César Milstein won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for theories concerning the specificity in development and control of this bodily defense system.
In 2019, three scientists were awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for their development of this type of battery, now powering everything from phones to electric cars.

categories.name: Tales from the Silk Road: Ancient Trade and Culture

questions.clue: This valuable fabric, originating in China, was so prized that it lent its name to the famous trade route.
Not just for sushi, this pungent green condiment, now known worldwide, originated from a plant that also traveled along the Silk Road.
This city, once a major hub on the Silk Road, is now the capital of Uzbekistan and was famous for its blue-tiled mosques.
This animal, essential for transporting goods across the Silk Road's harsh terrains, is known as the 'Ship of the Desert.'
This Japanese city, once part of the Silk Road's maritime routes, is now renowned for its sushi culture.

categories.name: The Wonders of Wasabi: Spice Up Your Knowledge

questions.clue: Often served with sushi, this green paste is known for its intense heat and flavor.
True wasabi comes from the root of a plant that shares this scientific name with horseradish.
In Japan, wasabi is traditionally grated against this type of material to achieve a fine texture.
Most commercial 'wasabi' is actually a mix of horseradish, mustard, and this green vegetable dye.
questions.answer: What is spinach or spirulina extract?

questions.clue: This component in wasabi is responsible for its pungent aroma and can also be found in mustard and horseradish.

categories.name: Tuna Tales: From Ocean to Table

questions.clue: This type of tuna, known for its deep red color, is a popular choice for sushi and sashimi.
This spicy green paste made from a root is often served alongside tuna sushi.
This largest species of tuna, known for being overfished, can grow to over 1,000 pounds.
In Japanese cuisine, this term refers to fatty tuna belly, prized for its rich flavor and buttery texture.
This term describes the practice of catching tuna with a rod and line to reduce bycatch and environmental impact.

final.clue: This spicy green paste, often served with sushi, is traditionally made by grinding the root of a plant native to Japan and has been used for centuries.
